code: @Manual{,   title = {bssvd: Make Scaled SVD Objects},   author = {John Bryant},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://bayesiandemography.github.io/bssvd/}, }

title: Make Scaled SVD Objects
text: Use data international demographic databases create objects capture regularities demographic rates. bssvd supports package bage, intended used directly data analysis.

title: Make Scaled SVD Objects
text: can install development version bssvd GitHub :

title: Make Scaled SVD Objects
code: library(bssvd) library(rsdmx) url <- paste("https://sdmx.oecd.org/public/rest/data",              "OECD.ELS.SAE,DSD_LFS@DF_LFS_INDIC,1.1",              "all?dimensionAtObservation=AllDimensions",              sep = "/") lfp_sdmx <- rsdmx::readSDMX(url) lfp_df <- as.data.frame(lfp_sdmx) lfp <- data_ssvd_lfp(lfp_df)

Prepare Data frome Human Mortality Database — data_ssvd_hmd
text: zipfile name zipped file downloaded Human Mortality Database. path name handled utils::unzip(). n_comp Number SVD components include result. Default 10.

title: Prepare Data frome Human Mortality Database — data_ssvd_hmd
text: tibble format required function bage::ssvd().

title: Prepare Data frome Human Mortality Database — data_ssvd_hmd
text: Step 1: Download data Register log Human Mortality Database, go page Downloading HMD zipped data files. Go "Previous Versions" table bottom page, download file "Statistics" column, eg file https://www.mortality.org/File/Download/hmd.v6/zip/all_hmd/hmd_statistics_20240226.zip Step 2: Call function 'svd_hmd' Put file working directory, supply name file function data_ssvd_hmd(), eg

Prepare OECD Data on Labour Force Participation Rates — data_ssvd_lfp

title: Prepare OECD Data on Labour Force Participation Rates — data_ssvd_lfp
text: tibble format required function bage::ssvd().

title: Prepare OECD Data on Labour Force Participation Rates — data_ssvd_lfp
text: Step 1: Download data   Step 2: Call function 'data_ssvd_lfp()'
code: library(rsdmx) url <- paste("https://sdmx.oecd.org/public/rest/data",              "OECD.ELS.SAE,DSD_LFS@DF_LFS_INDIC,1.1",              "all?dimensionAtObservation=AllDimensions",              sep = "/") lfp_sdmx <- rsdmx::readSDMX(url)    ## can be slow data <- as.data.frame(lfp_sdmx)     ## can also be slow lfp_data <- data_ssvd_lfp(data)

title: Prepare OECD Data on Labour Force Participation Rates — data_ssvd_lfp
code: lfp_data_small <- data_ssvd_lfp(oecd_lfp) #> Tidying data... #> Carrying out SVD for 'total'... #> Carrying out SVD for 'indep'... #> Carrying out SVD for 'joint'... #> Combining results...

what: Create components needed by a ssvd object — make_matrix_and_offset
title: Create components needed by a ssvd object — make_matrix_and_offset
text: Use Singular Value Decomposition (SVD) construct parsimonious representation set rates, probabilities, means, values.

title: Create components needed by a ssvd object — make_matrix_and_offset
Create components needed by a ssvd object — make_matrix_and_offset
text: x matrix value rates, probabilities, means. transform "log", "logit", "none". Defaults "log". n_comp Number components.

title: Create components needed by a ssvd object — make_matrix_and_offset
text: named list two elements: matrix, numeric matrix offset, numeric vector

title: Create components needed by a ssvd object — make_matrix_and_offset
text: `make_matrix_and_offset() typically proceeds follows: transform values matrix x (eg take logs) carry SVD transformed version x centre scale results SVD produce matrix matrix vector offset. \(X\) matrix transformed values x \(F\) matrix called matrix, \(g\) vector called offset, \(\alpha\) vector standard normal variates, $$\beta = F \alpha + g$$ \(\beta\) look like randomly-selected column \(X\). Matrix x typically age along rows, combination classification variables, country time, along columns. One exception SVD used capture relationship female male rates, case rows formed interacting sex age. See example. scale "log" "logit", make_matrix_and_offset() converts 0s x values just 0 applying log logit function. scale "logit", make_matrix_and_offset() also converts 1s values just 1`.

title: Create components needed by a ssvd object — make_matrix_and_offset

title: OECD data on Labour Force Participation — oecd_lfp
text: Downloaded table "Employment unemployment five-year age group sex - indicators" OECD Data Explorer. Accessed 21 April 2024. subset full dataset included oecd_lpr.

title: OECD data on Labour Force Participation — oecd_lfp
text: labour force participation rate number people labour force (ie number people currently employed unemployed) proportion population.

what: Create a Scaled SVD Object from HFD Age-Specific Fertility Data — ssvd_hfd
title: Create a Scaled SVD Object from HFD Age-Specific Fertility Data — ssvd_hfd
text: Create object class "bage_ssvd" age-specific fertility data Human Fertility Database.

title: Create a Scaled SVD Object from HFD Age-Specific Fertility Data — ssvd_hfd
Create a Scaled SVD Object from HFD Age-Specific Fertility Data — ssvd_hfd
text: data data frame containing HFD data. age_min_max, age_max_min Every age classification must least span range [age_min_max, age_max_min). Defaults 15 50. n_comp Number SVD components include result. Default 5.

title: Create a Scaled SVD Object from HFD Age-Specific Fertility Data — ssvd_hfd
text: object class "bage_ssvd"

title: Create a Scaled SVD Object from HFD Age-Specific Fertility Data — ssvd_hfd
text: original HFD data contains age groups "12-" (ie 12 younger) "55+" (ie 55 older). treat closed intervals "12" "55". age classification return value covers narrower range data , youngest age group return value includes ASFRs younger age groups data, oldest age group return value includes ASFRs older age groups data. instance, classification return value starts age 15, data starts age 12, ASFR age 15 includes ASFRs ages 12, 13, 14. shifting ASFRs common analyses fertility.

title: Create a Scaled SVD Object from HFD Age-Specific Fertility Data — ssvd_hfd
text: Step 1: Download data Register log Human Fertility Database, go page ZippedDataFiles. Go "statistic" table, download file "Age-specific fertility rate" row. Step 2: Call function 'ssvd_hfd' Extract file asfrRR.txt downloaded data, read contents,   Step 3: Call function 'ssvd_hfd'

title: Create a Scaled SVD Object from HFD Age-Specific Fertility Data — ssvd_hfd
code: HFD_small <- ssvd_hfd(asfr) #> Error in if (n < min) cli::cli_abort(c("{.arg {nm_n}} is less than {min}.",     i = "{.arg {nm_n}} is {.val {n}}.")): argument is of length zero
